subject: Politics
title: The Attention Economy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Attention Economy.

hook.text: You are the product. Social media sells your attention to advertisers. Your eyeballs are the real commodity.

buildup.text: The attention economy means platforms compete for your time. The longer you scroll, the more ads they sell.

discovery.text: Notifications, infinite scroll, and autoplay are designed to be addictive. Your brain is being hacked for profit.

twist.text: Political content thrives in the attention economy. Outrage, fear, and tribalism are the most engaging emotions.

climax.text: Democracy needs informed, thoughtful citizens. The attention economy produces distracted, outraged ones instead.

punchline.text: Attention is the new currency. Whoever captures it controls the conversation.

quiz.question: Why does political content perform well in the attention economy?
options: Outrage, fear, and tribalism are the most engaging emotions that drive clicks
Political content is always factual and educational
Platforms deliberately promote only political news
